text: RT @BarackObama Today reminds us that progress might be slow. It might take decades. But no matter what things might look like today, it’s always possible. Happy Pride month, everybody. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EamETmPXkAETsTY.jpg

2 weeks ago I warned that various types of armed groups are showing up at protests

Now reports that a vigilante militia group in New Mexico may have shot a man to protect a statue

No matter what their ideology or motivation we must reject ALL VIOLENT EXTREMISTS https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1272775942935543808 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaoMBzHWoAI6m4Y.jpg QT @nytimes A man was shot during a protest Monday night in Albuquerque. Police took into custody several members of a right-wing militia called the New Mexico Civil Guard who were carrying rifles. It was not clear whether any of them had fired the shot. https://trib.al/By5PVz3

A clean heart create for me, God; renew within me a steadfast spirit.

Psalms 51:12

We will have #PPP loan disclosure 

No dispute over larger loan recipients being disclosed 

Only issue still being discussed with administration is how to treat smaller loans to mostly micro-business,sole proprietors & independent contractors

In video obtained by a local tv reporter a man,who she reports didn’t appear to have ties with local vigilante militia,is attacked by group trying to bring down a statue

Then someone fired shots 

This is what anarchy looks like & it must end

http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1272735657362731009/pu/img/CnSSAn2CmgTJhKQ3.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1272735657362731009/pu/vid/320x568/b8wd10ksN7ySQ4Aj.mp4?tag=10

The people of NY-16 deserve an accountable, compassionate leader who will make their voices heard. I know that @JamaalBowmanNY will be a champion for working people in Washington and I’m honored to stand shoulder to shoulder with him in this fight. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaokrPKXsAAAaJf.jpg
I’ll be damned if when a COVID-19 vaccine is developed, more people die because they can’t afford to purchase it. Any life-saving vaccine must be free.

.@TheJusticeDept⁩ has launched an online portal to make it easier for public to report civil rights violations

No,this doesn’t solve all our problems on race & civil rights

But if it works & legitimate claims are followed up on it is a positive step https://civilrights.justice.gov/

The truth is that real change never happens from the top on down — it happens from the bottom on up.

Let’s do everything we can to elect progressives from one part of the country to the rest.

Sign up here for our Day of Action this Saturday:
https://act.berniesanders.com/signup/fobs-june-day-of-action/?source=tw200616-1

Women, especially women of color, are bearing the brunt of this economic crisis. Congress must immediately pass my bill to provide $2,000 every month throughout this pandemic. When we lift up the women of our country, our whole society benefits.
https://twitter.com/voxdotcom/status/1272139372926775301 QT @voxdotcom Nationwide, 13.9% of women are currently unemployed, compared with 11.6% of men.

In particular, black women face 16.5% unemployment, while Latina women face 19%.
https://trib.al/5sOwusC

RT @ava This is a white woman talking honestly about her experiences and its one of the best threads on the criminalization of Black people that I’ve read lately. https://twitter.com/kristavernoff/status/1272561179462754304 QT @KristaVernoff When I was 15, I was chased through a mall by police who were yelling “Stop thief!” I had thousands of dollars of stolen merchandise on me.  I was caught, booked, sentenced to 6 months of probation, required to see a parole officer weekly. I was never even handcuffed.  

THREAD:

We must take great #pride in how far we’ve come. But we must not rest until we fully end discrimination against all LGBTQ Americans. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1272535337743646720 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1272910231761231873/pu/img/4SGpbslS-viAe7u_.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1272910231761231873/pu/vid/480x270/1W80ryHbY0szPk9A.mp4?tag=10 QT @nytimes Breaking News: In a landmark ruling, the Supreme Court found that a 1964 civil rights law protects L.G.B.T. workers from discrimination https://trib.al/m9L08zg

This pandemic is not going away any time soon. Our people are struggling. A one-time $1,200 check sure as hell ain’t cutting it. 

Congress has got to get its act together and provide monthly $2,000 payments to all—and make it cover the past three months. https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/15/us/us-coronavirus-monday/index.html

NEW JERSEY: Today is the final day to register to vote in the upcoming primary on July 7th.

If you are not registered, get your application in today. Here's info on how to apply: https://www.state.nj.us/state/elections/voter-registration.shtml

Today I introduced the Work Safe Act, a commonsense solution to increase testing and restore confidence among consumers, employees, and employers that people who return to work are being regularly tested for #COVID19.
Good news for #Florida! @USDOTFHWA announced a more than $10 million grant to @MyFDOT for the I-4 FRAME project.

Trump’s executive order does not go nearly far enough to create the kind of change our country is demanding to see. Americans are taking to the streets in all 50 states for widespread, systemic changes to our system of policing. We must sign into law our Justice in Policing Act.

.@FoxNews: Cruz rolls out bill to provide tax credits to businesses who test employees for #coronavirus weekly https://www.foxnews.com/politics/cruz-rolls-out-bill-to-provide-tax-credits-to-businesses-who-test-employees-for-covid-19-weekly

Yesterday’s landmark decision by the Supreme Court was a win in the fight for LGBTQ+ equality—but we still have work to do. Just last week, HHS announced plans to rollback health care protections for transgender Americans. And we know it won’t stop there.

We must keep fighting.

Oluwatoyin “Toyin” Salau was only 19. The news of her death is absolutely gut-wrenching.

She spent her last days fighting for justice. Now, we must commit to fighting for her. #JusticeForToyin
https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/2020/06/15/oluwatoyin-salau-found-dead-tallahassee-black-lives-matter-protest-missing/3190021001/

Fed Chair Powell confirmed to me today: Black families hit hard by the economic crisis are not recovering as quickly. We can’t just cut off unemployment benefits & say the problem is over the minute jobs start recovering for white Americans. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eap6dbpXsAATc7A.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1272963418601947136/vid/480x270/VDGVCFQTo2rEfLrX.mp4?tag=13

Trump and Pence are once again trying to downplay the seriousness of this pandemic just so they can look good. They’ve learned nothing from the devastating consequences of their mismanagement.

Deeply saddened to learn the @USAirForce pilot was Utah's own 1st Lt. Kenneth "Kage" Allen—a young man known for his faith, kindness, and patriotism. Ann and I send our thoughts and our prayers to Kage's wife Hannah, his friends, and loved ones. https://www.stripes.com/news/europe/he-was-the-love-of-my-life-air-force-pilot-who-died-in-f-15-crash-remembered-for-his-kindness-and-faith-1.633928

The President’s Executive Order falls seriously short of what is required to combat the epidemic of racial injustice & police brutality that is murdering Black Americans. We must insist on the bold change found in the George Floyd #JusticeInPolicing Act. https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/61620

As chairman of the Subcommittee on Aviation and Space, I introduced a bill with @SenatorSinema & @SenToddYoung that will help #TX airports incentivize contractors to finish projects on time & under a budget – saving travelers & taxpayers time and money.

Congratulations to Rick Krajewski, Nikil Saval, and other progressives who are winning elections at the state and local level. President Trump’s effort to dismantle the Postal Service would be a disaster for our seniors. We can't let Trump and his cronies have their way. Congress must act to save the Postal Service so seniors can access life-saving medication and mail-in ballots. https://www.commondreams.org/views/2020/06/15/trump-usps-and-seniors

Calls to defund the police are profoundly dangerous & will hurt our low-income communities the most. As congressional Democrats focus on delegitimizing law enforcement, Senate Republicans are focused on how to keep all Americans safe from violence & crime. https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-police-can-help-rebuild-lives-11592235073?mod=opinion_lead_pos9

Democrats only need four seats to flip the Senate and finally remove Mitch McConnell as Senate Majority Leader. Can you split a donation now between four competitive Senate races? Every bit makes a difference.
https://secure.actblue.com/donate/mek-core4?refcode=tw200616-kdh

Congress has sent nearly $3T to workers, families, businesses, & state/local governments in response to the #CoronavirusPandemic. Yesterday on behalf of taxpayers I joined @SenRickScott & @SenRonJohnson in asking US governors how they are using these funds to #CombatCOVID19. https://twitter.com/SenRickScott/status/1272631812855136256 QT @SenRickScott Today, @SenRonJohnson, @SenTedCruz & I sent a letter to US Governors requesting information on how their states have allocated the taxpayer funding from the CARES Act & other federal coronavirus funds.
 
We must make sure taxpayer $$ is being properly spent. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EalL2PSWkAANtCB.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EalL2PSWoAYgx_1.jpg

The stakes couldn't be higher. We must take back the Senate in November. That is why I am asking you to help our Democratic challengers in four must-win races in Arizona, Colorado, Maine, and North Carolina.  

Please chip in if you can.

Justin Walker is an unqualified conservative zealot, & his relentless attacks on the Affordable Care Act pose a danger to millions. Rather than confirming Walker in the midst of a global pandemic, the Senate should do its job & turn to the HEROES Act & Justice in Policing Act.

Instead of addressing the public health & economic crisis or the systemic racism in our policing system, Mitch McConnell is using the Senate floor to ram through the nomination of his 38-year-old protégé Justin Walker to a lifetime appointment on the DC Circuit.
I’m not going to let up on this. We need an investigation into whether Bill Barr ordered peaceful protesters to be forcibly removed from near the White House—using tear gas.

The people are crying out against police brutality and murder; the pandemic is spreading around the country and over 30 million workers have lost their jobs. Yet the Do Nothing Republican Senate does nothing. I will be on the floor tomorrow. The Senate must act NOW.

Joining my colleagues momentarily on the Senate floor to honor Reverend Martin Luther King Jr.’s legacy of peaceful protest against racial inequality & to recognize the 57th anniversary of his Letter from Birmingham Jail.
 
WATCH live here —> https://www.senate.gov/floor/

Sen. Rubio joined @ChrisCoons, @SenatorWicker and a group of bipartisan colleagues in introducing the #CORPSAct, legislation to expand national service programs to help the US respond to and recover from the effects of the #COVID19 pandemic.

@IlhanMN I know there are no words that can make the loss of someone you loved so deeply any less painful. My heart and my prayers are with you during this difficult time.

President Trump forced hazardous meat plants to reopen to protect the profits of large corporations over the lives of meatpacking workers who got sick and died from coronavirus.

Beyond disgusting. It's time to put people before profits. https://twitter.com/greenhousenyt/status/1272958447986839554 QT @greenhousenyt Meatpacking companies said their plants needed to stay open, warning that the U.S. faced a severe meat shortage.  At least 89 meatpacking workers died

It was a fake meat shortage. Turns out American meatpackers shipped a record amount of pork to China. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/16/business/meat-industry-china-pork.html?smid=tw-share

Today is a time for every American to look back at the incredible call for justice and unity that Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. gave us. Now more than ever, we need to hear his words. We need to hear his message. And we need to stand for justice and unity, just as Dr. King did. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1273003217027244034/img/19TLL0lAksgEZf0e.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1273003217027244034/vid/480x270/IK6CAuFMoWoq4V-c.mp4?tag=13

Trump's policing Executive Order is meaningless. Since day one he's used racially charged rhetoric all while rolling back efforts to root out racism in policing and virtually abandoning police misconduct investigations. We need real reforms. Pass the Justice in Policing Act now.

Great read by @michaelsobolik on why the U.S. should be concerned about the Chinese Communist Party’s encroachment in Hong Kong.
https://www.newsweek.com/what-china-hong-kong-opinion-1511063

We now have a choice between making meaningful reforms to our system of policing, or making symbolic gestures that will do nothing to save people's lives. Our Justice in Policing Act is a real effort to hold policing in America accountable for egregious behavior. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1273021360810450951/img/4rgX_fL5U-hdqXlD.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1273021360810450951/vid/480x270/EWQ2_oGX_hKm0t0L.mp4?tag=13

Our Justice in Policing Act would:
✅Set a national standard for use of force
✅Expand pattern and practice investigations
✅Increase independent investigations into police misconduct

We can hold police accountable—Congress just needs to act.

How many more have to die before Mitch McConnell hears America’s cries for #JusticeInPolicing? 

The self-named “Grim Reaper” should bring himself to care about the mounting deaths around the country, including doing what’s right by #BreonnaTaylor’s family in Kentucky. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1273018876389928964/pu/img/E4ttevWXmwPpl0wr.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1273018876389928964/pu/vid/480x270/Z4Vtod9q1eyKNbNP.mp4?tag=10

The #JusticeInPolicing Act represents a giant step forward in the fight against police brutality. This about saving lives — Leader McConnell’s opposition makes it clear how committed he is to living up to “Grim Reaper” moniker he has given himself. #DeadlineWH http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EarB98cXgAEN6Fp.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1273042049592369154/vid/480x270/8SST1fVU394rl6Ai.mp4?tag=13

RT @IndivisibleTeam New Yorkers! TODAY is the deadline for absentee ballot requests, but you can still vote in-person early all this week, and in-person the day of on 6/23. Make your plan to vote today and make sure your voice is heard.

It’s been an honor to get to know and support some amazing Democrats running up and down the ballot and all across the country.

You can get to know them too, right here—and if you’re inspired by their righteous fights, chip in or sign up to volunteer.

https://elizabethwarren.com/endorsements?source=soc-WB-ew-tw-endorsements-61620

Here’s one proposition I believe everyone on @senjudiciary agrees with: what happened to Mr. Floyd was unconscionable. It was a grotesque abuse of police power.
 
But to impugn the integrity of everyone working in law enforcement is a disservice to this nation. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1273011772660887552/img/XbA5s80dyAOVGt4E.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1273011772660887552/vid/480x270/Oa4La7d-RD6z6ojF.mp4?tag=13

Black men found dead hanging by rope are painful reminders of America’s history of lynchings. Officials must thoroughly investigate the circumstances of these deaths. Their families deserve answers.  https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/feds-review-investigations-two-black-men-found-hanging-southern-california-n1231139

People are not marching in the streets for watered-down proposals that won't hold police officers accountable for misconduct. About to join @ErinBurnett on @CNN at 7:30pm ET to discuss our Justice in Policing Act and how we can make real, meaningful reforms to policing.

RT @StevePtweets Was honored to have @SenWarren join us for this special @DemocracyColor podcast episode.  She did *not* disappoint & brought the fire! Especially on systemic racism and anti-racist activism. Check it out and please share! https://democracyincolor.com/podepisodes/2020/6/16/elizabeth-warren-talks-anti-racism

In calling for justice, Dr. King did not endeavor to tear down the foundations of our nation. Instead, he made an explicit appeal to the promises this nation was founded upon: that all men are created equal. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1273003217027244034/img/19TLL0lAksgEZf0e.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1273003217027244034/vid/480x270/IK6CAuFMoWoq4V-c.mp4?tag=13

RT @JoeBiden Systemic racism pervades every part of our society, including law enforcement — and we have to do the hard work to root it out. In January, I sat down with Jake, a field organizer on our campaign, to listen to what he had to say and discuss how we can move forward: http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1272934170663272449/img/d7XE1dLYfQJGYTwt.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1272934170663272449/vid/480x270/gBACkdSMwWtPbI0J.mp4?tag=13

Some people in Congress want to let the COVID-19 unemployment benefits expire.

But we can’t just say "the problem is fixed!" while millions are still suffering—or while Black unemployment is still increasing.

https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2020/6/6/21282611/black-workers-left-behind-unemployment

President Trump claimed he was offering a real solution to police brutality. The #FakeReform he offered instead fell far short. #DeadlineWH http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EarTfWpX0AAOYgn.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1273061952009523201/vid/480x270/qU1G9VG9ptwNy5Lr.mp4?tag=13

We’ve seen enough death. We’ve had enough commissions. We've had enough studies. We've convened enough leaders. We've had enough conversations.

Now is the time to act. The people are demanding it. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EarS_RfX0AA186z.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1273061616989470724/vid/320x320/hObKtpyStpth3m3E.mp4?tag=13

The Justice in Policing Act would require real accountability and consequence from those in the system who break the rules and break the law. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EarRdKZX0AEhUiy.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1273059497444020227/vid/480x270/UvaMsatABVRyazOT.mp4?tag=13

The White House ignored the threat of COVID-19 until it was too late to stop it, left states without the equipment to fight it, & didn’t track its spread to contain it. Now they want to wave a magic wand & declare "Mission Accomplished."
 
Wake up & get to work, @VP Pence.

And if @VP Pence is bored, he could find out why @CDCgov still has huge gaps in its race & ethnicity data so we make sure our federal response is reaching Black & Brown communities hit hardest by this crisis. This shouldn’t wait until the August deadline. https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/14/missing-data-veils-coronavirus-damage-to-minority-communities-316198

We need more COVID-19 tests, more PPE, & a vaccine – & a federal government that can distribute them at scale. Which is why Trump & @VP Pence should be using the DPA now & championing my bill to publicly manufacture COVID-19 supplies. https://www.vox.com/2020/4/30/21241842/coronavirus-covid-supply-shortages-ppe-elizabeth-warren

The White House has failed to obtain & distribute medical supplies. Last week I urged @COVID_Oversight to investigate Jared Kushner's Project Air Bridge after we found delays, incompetence, confusion, & ethics concerns. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/senators-seek-investigation-into-project-airbridge-deliveries-of-protective-medical-gear/2020/06/09/935b2454-a516-11ea-bb20-ebf0921f3bbd_story.html

As head of the White House Coronavirus Task Force, @VP Pence should be getting ready for the alarming possibility of another coronavirus wave on top of a bad flu season. I warned the Vice President to prepare last month. https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/21/health/senators-coronavirus-flu-fall/index.html

Coronavirus keeps spreading across the country. Hundreds of Americans are still dying every day. And Dr. Fauci confirmed to me last month that another wave of coronavirus is “inevitable.” @VP Pence shouldn’t be celebrating – he should be making a plan. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EX2zg3gXkAE3r0h.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1260359741534081025/vid/480x270/vjl-2Vvs7IQyYAC6.mp4?tag=13

So that’s it, @VP Pence? You’re just going to close your eyes, plug your ears, & pat yourself on the back for the public health catastrophe under your watch? This is as pathetic as it is reckless. https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/vice-president-mike-pence-op-ed-isnt-coronavirus-second-wave/
